name: AgentQL
description: Enable AI agents to get structured data from unstructured web with AgentQL.
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates AgentQL's data extraction capabilities, allowing users to extract structured data from web pages.

tools.name: extract-web-data
tools.description: Extracts structured data from a given URL using a prompt to describe the data and fields to extract.

parameter.url: (string) The URL of the web page to extract data from.
parameter.prompt: (string) A description of the actual data and its fields to extract.

name: Aiven
description: Navigate your Aiven projects and interact with the PostgreSQL®, Apache Kafka®, ClickHouse® and OpenSearch® services
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Aiven, providing access to various Aiven services such as PostgreSQL, Kafka, ClickHouse, Valkey, and OpenSearch, enabling LLMs to build full stack solutions.

tools.name: list_projects
tools.description: List all projects on your Aiven account.

tools.name: list_services
tools.description: List all services in a specific Aiven project.

tools.name: get_service_details
tools.description: Get the detail of your service in a specific Aiven project.

name: Alibaba Cloud AnalyticDB for MySQL
description: Connect to a AnalyticDB for MySQL cluster for getting database or table metadata, querying and analyzing data.It will be supported to add the openapi for cluster operation in the future.
summary: A universal interface between AI Agents and AnalyticDB for MySQL databases, enabling seamless communication for retrieving database metadata and executing SQL operations.

tools.name: execute_sql
tools.description: Execute a SQL query in the AnalyticDB for MySQL Cluster

tools.name: get_query_plan
tools.description: Get the query plan for a SQL query

tools.name: get_execution_plan
tools.description: Get the actual execution plan with runtime statistics for a SQL query

name: Apache IoTDB
description: MCP Server for Apache IoTDB database and its tools
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation that provides database interaction and business intelligence capabilities through IoTDB. It enables running SQL queries.

tools.name: metadata_query
tools.description: Execute SHOW/COUNT queries to read metadata from the database

parameter.query_sql: (string) The SHOW/COUNT SQL query to execute

tools.name: select_query
tools.description: Execute SELECT queries to read data from the database

parameter.query_sql: (string) The SELECT SQL query to execute

tools.name: read_query
tools.description: Execute SELECT queries to read data from the database

parameter.query: (string) The SELECT SQL query to execute

tools.name: list_tables
tools.description: Get a list of all tables in the database

tools.name: describe-table
tools.description: View schema information for a specific table

name: Apify
description: Actors MCP Server: Use 3,000+ pre-built cloud tools to extract data from websites, e-commerce, social media, search engines, maps, and more
summary: The Apify MCP Server enables interaction with Apify Actors as tools for performing various tasks, such as data extraction, web searching, and more. It supports both HTTP server (SSE) and local server (stdio) modes, and can be integrated with various MCP clients.

tools.name: get-actor-details
tools.description: Retrieves documentation, input schema, and details about a specific Actor.

tools.name: discover-actors
tools.description: Searches for relevant Actors using keywords and returns their details.

tools.name: add-actor-as-tool
tools.description: Adds an Actor by name to the available tools list without executing it, requiring user consent to run later.

tools.name: remove-actor-from-tool
tools.description: Removes an Actor by name from the available tools list when it's no longer needed.

name: APIMatic MCP
description: APIMatic MCP Server is used to validate OpenAPI specifications using APIMatic. The server processes OpenAPI files and returns validation summaries by leveraging APIMatic’s API.
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server for validating OpenAPI specifications using APIMatic. It supports OpenAPI 2.0 and 3.0 files in both JSON and YAML formats, leveraging APIMatic’s API for comprehensive validation.

tools.name: validate-openapi-using-apimatic
tools.description: Validates an OpenAPI file using APIMatic’s API and returns a validation summary.

name: Arize Phoenix
description: Inspect traces, manage prompts, curate datasets, and run experiments using Arize Phoenix, an open-source AI and LLM observability tool.
summary: An open-source AI observability platform designed for experimentation, evaluation, and troubleshooting. It provides tracing, evaluation, dataset management, experiment tracking, a playground for optimizing prompts, and prompt management.

tools.name: arize-phoenix-otel
tools.description: Provides a lightweight wrapper around OpenTelemetry primitives with Phoenix-aware defaults

tools.name: arize-phoenix-client
tools.description: Lightweight client for interacting with the Phoenix server via its OpenAPI REST interface

tools.name: arize-phoenix-evals
tools.description: Tooling to evaluate LLM applications including RAG relevance, answer relevance, and more

tools.name: @arizeai/phoenix-client
tools.description: Client for the Arize Phoenix API

tools.name: @arizeai/phoenix-mcp
tools.description: MCP server implementation for Arize Phoenix providing a unified interface to Phoenix's capabilities

name: Astra DB
description: Comprehensive tools for managing collections and documents in a DataStax Astra DB NoSQL database with a full range of operations such as create, update, delete, find, and associated bulk actions.
summary: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Astra DB, extending the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) by allowing them to interact with external systems as agents.

tools.name: GetCollections
tools.description: Get all collections in the database

tools.name: CreateCollection
tools.description: Create a new collection in the database

tools.name: UpdateCollection
tools.description: Update an existing collection in the database

tools.name: DeleteCollection
tools.description: Delete a collection from the database

tools.name: ListRecords
tools.description: List records from a collection in the database

tools.name: GetRecord
tools.description: Get a specific record from a collection by ID

tools.name: CreateRecord
tools.description: Create a new record in a collection

tools.name: UpdateRecord
tools.description: Update an existing record in a collection

tools.name: DeleteRecord
tools.description: Delete a record from a collection

tools.name: FindRecord
tools.description: Find records in a collection by field value

tools.name: BulkCreateRecords
tools.description: Create multiple records in a collection at once

tools.name: BulkUpdateRecords
tools.description: Update multiple records in a collection at once

tools.name: BulkDeleteRecords
tools.description: Delete multiple records from a collection at once

tools.name: OpenBrowser
tools.description: Open a web browser for authentication and setup

tools.name: HelpAddToClient
tools.description: Get assistance with adding Astra DB client to your MCP client

tools.name: EstimateDocumentCount
tools.description: Get estimate of the number of documents in a collection

name: Audiense Insights
description: Marketing insights and audience analysis from Audiense reports, covering demographic, cultural, influencer, and content engagement analysis.
summary: This server allows MCP-compatible clients to interact with an Audiense Insights account, extracting marketing insights and audience analysis including demographic, cultural, influencer, and content engagement data.

tools.name: get-reports
tools.description: Retrieves the list of Audiense insights reports owned by the authenticated user.

tools.name: get-report-info
tools.description: Fetches detailed information about a specific intelligence report, including status, segmentation type, audience size, segments, and access links.

parameter.report_id: (string) The ID of the intelligence report.

tools.name: get-audience-insights
tools.description: Retrieves aggregated insights for a given audience, including demographics, behavioral traits, psychographics, and socioeconomic factors.

parameter.audience_insights_id: (string) The ID of the audience insights.
parameter.insights: (array of strings, optional) List of specific insight names to filter.

tools.name: get-baselines
tools.description: Retrieves available baseline audiences, optionally filtered by country.

parameter.country: (string, optional) ISO country code to filter by.

tools.name: get-categories
tools.description: Retrieves the list of available affinity categories that can be used in influencer comparisons.

tools.name: compare-audience-influencers
tools.description: Compares influencers of a given audience with a baseline audience, providing affinity scores, baseline comparisons, and uniqueness scores.

parameter.baseline_audience_influencers_id: (string) ID of the baseline audience influencers.
parameter.count: (number, optional) Number of items per page (default: 200).
parameter.bio_keyword: (string, optional) Filter influencers by bio keyword.
parameter.entity_type: (enum: person | brand, optional) Filter by entity type.
parameter.categories: (array of strings, optional) Filter influencers by categories.
parameter.countries: (array of strings, optional) Filter influencers by country ISO codes.

tools.name: get-audience-content
tools.description: Retrieves audience content engagement details, including liked, shared, and influential content.

parameter.audience_content_id: (string) The ID of the audience content.

tools.name: report-summary
tools.description: Generates a comprehensive summary of an Audiense report, including metadata, audience size, segment information, top insights, and top influencers with comparison metrics.

parameter.report_id: (string) The ID of the intelligence report to summarize.

name: AWS
description: Specialized MCP servers that bring AWS best practices directly to your development workflow.
summary: A suite of specialized MCP servers that help you get the most out of AWS, wherever you use MCP. These servers enhance the capabilities of foundation models by providing relevant information, access to the latest documentation, workflow automation, and specialized domain knowledge for AWS services.

tools.name: Search Documentation
tools.description: Search AWS documentation and best practices using the official AWS search API.

tools.name: Get Content Recommendations
tools.description: Get content recommendations for AWS documentation pages.

tools.name: Convert Documentation to Markdown
tools.description: Convert AWS documentation to markdown format.

tools.name: Discover Knowledge Bases
tools.description: Discover Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases and their data sources.

tools.name: Query Knowledge Bases
tools.description: Query Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases with natural language.

tools.name: Filter Results by Data Source
tools.description: Filter query results by data source.

tools.name: Rerank Results
tools.description: Rerank query results.

tools.name: AWS CDK Project Analysis
tools.description: Analyze and assist with AWS CDK projects.

tools.name: CDK Construct Recommendations
tools.description: Provide recommendations for CDK constructs.

tools.name: Infrastructure as Code Best Practices
tools.description: Provide best practices for infrastructure as code.

tools.name: Analyze and Visualize Costs
tools.description: Analyze and visualize AWS costs.

tools.name: Query Cost Data with Natural Language
tools.description: Query cost data using natural language.

tools.name: Generate Cost Reports and Insights
tools.description: Generate detailed cost reports and insights.

tools.name: Text-Based Image Generation
tools.description: Generate images using text with customizable parameters.

tools.name: Color-Guided Image Generation
tools.description: Generate images with specific color palettes.

tools.name: Save Generated Images
tools.description: Save generated images to the workspace.

tools.name: Generate Professional Diagrams
tools.description: Generate professional diagrams using Python code.

tools.name: Customize Diagram Appearance
tools.description: Customize the appearance, layout, and styling of diagrams.

tools.name: Code Scanning for Secure Diagram Generation
tools.description: Scan code to ensure secure diagram generation.

tools.name: Run AWS Lambda Functions
tools.description: Select and run AWS Lambda functions as MCP tools without code changes.

tools.name: Security-First Development Workflow
tools.description: Implement a security-first development workflow.

tools.name: Checkov Integration
tools.description: Integrate Checkov for security checks.

tools.name: AWS and AWSCC Provider Documentation
tools.description: Provide documentation for AWS and AWSCC providers.

tools.name: AWS-IA GenAI Modules
tools.description: Use AWS-IA GenAI modules.

tools.name: Terraform Workflow Execution
tools.description: Execute Terraform workflows.

tools.name: Search for Places Using Geocoding
tools.description: Search for places using geocoding.

tools.name: Get Details for Specific Places
tools.description: Get details for specific places by PlaceId.

tools.name: Reverse Geocode Coordinates to Addresses
tools.description: Reverse geocode coordinates to addresses.

tools.name: Search for Places Near a Location
tools.description: Search for places near a specified location.

tools.name: Search for Places That Are Currently Open
tools.description: Search for places that are currently open.

tools.name: Calculate Routes Between Locations
tools.description: Calculate routes between locations with turn-by-turn directions.

tools.name: Optimize Waypoints for Efficient Routing
tools.description: Optimize waypoints for efficient routing.

tools.name: Repository Indexing
tools.description: Index Git repositories using FAISS and Amazon Bedrock embeddings.

tools.name: Semantic Search Within Repositories
tools.description: Perform semantic search within repositories.

tools.name: Repository Structure Analysis
tools.description: Analyze the structure of repositories.

tools.name: GitHub Repository Search in AWS Organizations
tools.description: Search GitHub repositories within AWS organizations.

tools.name: File Access with Text and Binary Support
tools.description: Access files with text and binary support.
